Potato___Early_blight: Remove affected leaves, apply Mancozeb or Chlorothalonil fungicide, and avoid overhead irrigation.
Potato___healthy: Your potato plant is healthy! Maintain regular watering and balanced fertilization.
Potato___Late_blight: Spray Copper oxychloride or Metalaxyl-based fungicides. Remove and destroy infected plants immediately.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus: No direct cure. Remove infected plants, disinfect tools, and use resistant tomato varieties.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus: Control whiteflies with insecticides or neem oil, remove infected plants, and plant resistant varieties.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot: Apply copper-based sprays. Avoid overhead watering and use disease-free seeds.
Tomato___Early_blight: Use fungicides like Chlorothalonil or Mancozeb. Remove lower infected leaves to improve airflow.
Tomato___healthy: Your tomato plant is healthy! Continue proper watering, fertilization, and pest monitoring.
Tomato___Late_blight: Spray with Metalaxyl + Mancozeb combination. Remove and destroy infected plants to prevent spread.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold: Improve ventilation in the field, avoid leaf wetness, and apply fungicides like Chlorothalonil.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot: Remove affected leaves and apply fungicides such as Chlorothalonil or Copper sprays.
Tomato___Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider: Spray neem oil or miticides. Increase humidity around plants and introduce natural predators like ladybugs.
